member.name: T:EPiServer.Commerce.ApplicationContext
member.summary: Contains information about the current application context

member.name: P:EPiServer.Commerce.ApplicationContext.HasContentModelTypes
member.summary: Indicates whether the current application has the IContent model types for catalog content available. Considers the models available if there is at least one available which is decorated with the .

member.name: P:EPiServer.Commerce.ApplicationContext.SkipContentModelCheck
member.summary: Gets the episerver:SkipCatalogContentModelCheck appSetting, indicating wheter the value returned by should be ignored. Setting this to true means operations that require the content models for catalog content are considered safe even if there are no classes decorated with . This is useful for sites that don't use typed models.
member.remarks: The appSetting should under no circumstances be used in applications that share a database with an application which HAS content type models, e.g. in the Commerce Manager application.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Commerce.ApplicationContext.DisableVersionSync
member.summary: Gets the value of the DisableVersionSync appSetting, indicating whether an update to Catalog content done outside the Content APIs will remove any version data (e.g. drafts, old published versions...) for the affected Content. Setting this to true can improve the speed of batch operations done through the lower-level API:s (like ICatalogSystem), e.g. the catalog import.
member.value: true to delete all versions; false to update versions if content models are available.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Commerce.Catalog.Internal.CatalogLanguageSettingsResolver
member.summary:
This type/member supports the EPiServer infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Extends the default language settings resolver with logic for catalog content. The logic is as follows: - No replacement languages - No fallback languages - All languages that are enabled for a catalog are active, the others are not.

member.returns: An IEnumerable{ContentLanguageSetting} with the language settings for the given content.

After calling this method, any attempt to change the object instance or any contained object will generate a . I.e. the semantics is "deep read-only".
Note! After setting an object to read-only it is not possible to revert back to read-write mode. You will have to call the CreateWritableClone method to get a copy that can be modified.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Commerce.Catalog.Provider.Internal.CatalogContentMoveHandler.MoveCatalogNode(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the catalog node to new parent, recursively. This function will update the parent catalog node id of the moving catalog node and catalog id (if needed) for all child objects of it.
member.param: The catalog node id to set as parent node for the node.

The target catalog id. If this is different than the current catalog id, it will be set on the node, descendent nodes and node entry relations related to the node. For any primary node entry relations, the catalog id of the entries will also be updated.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Commerce.Marketing.AffectedEntries
member.summary: Used for handling redemption calculations on entry promotions.
member.remarks:
An example of typical usage of this class:
You have a "Buy 3 pay for 2" type of discount. The AffectedEntries would be filled with a quantity of three (corresponding to the "Buy 3" part), and you would call SetDiscountRange with parameters 2, 1 to indicate that the discount would be applied to the last item (skip 2 and apply to the final single quantity).
Note that setting a discount range and iterating over that range might mean that the configuration of the underlying list might change, since individual price entries might be split to support the requests. There is even support for having fractional quantities.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of a .

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of a that is a copy of .

member.summary: Gets the price entries

member.summary: Identifier to track this specific instance.

member.summary: The total quantity of entries in this instance.

member.summary: Creates a shallow copy of the instance.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Commerce.Marketing.AffectedEntries.SetDiscountRange(System.Decimal,System.Decimal)
member.summary: Set the range on this instance that will have actual discounting applied to it.
member.param: The amount of quantity to skip from the beginning of the list.
The quantity to actually use when applying discounts.
member.returns: This instance.
member.remarks: You can reset the discount range by calling this method with both parameters set to 0.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Commerce.Marketing.AffectedEntries.DiscountRange
member.summary: Gets the subset range of this instance based on values set in
member.returns: An that can be used to iterate over the contained PriceEntries.

member.summary: Gets information about the saved amount per code.
member.returns: A Dictionary that contains the code as key and the saved amount as value.
member.remarks: Note that the iteration is done over the current discount range.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Commerce.Marketing.AffectedEntries.ForEachCode``1(System.Func{EPiServer.Commerce.Marketing.PriceEntry,``0,``0})
member.summary: Enumerates over all entries in the current discount range and performs calculation per entry code.
member.typeparam: The resulting type of the calculation, usually decimal if summing up values.
member.param: The actual calculation to perform. Takes a and an accumulator and returns the accumulator together with the new value.
member.returns: A Dictionary that contains the code as key and the final result of the calculation as value.
member.remarks: Note that the iteration is done over the current discount range, which is usually the only interesting part. If you need to iterate over the entire range of entries, reset by calling SetDiscountRange(0, 0).

member.name: M:EPiServer.Commerce.Marketing.IPromotionProcessor.GetPromotionItems(EPiServer.Commerce.Marketing.PromotionData)
member.summary: Gets information about the settings for a specific instance of a promotion type. Used when displaying promotion information to a site visitor/shopper.

remarks.para: This method is intended to be used on a site to display information about a promotion to a visitor/shopper.

It is never used during the evaluation of the promotion, it only exists to provide information about the settings for this instance of a promotion type. So a use case for this could be that you have a "Buy 3 get the cheapest for one for free" promotion. And you want to display information to the visitor/shopper that "If you buy three items from the category cooking books, you will get the cheapest one for free".
This method should not be called explicitly from the site code. It will be called from the IPromotionEngine extension method GetPromotionItemsForCampaign.

member.param: The promotion data to get items for.
member.returns: The promotion condition and reward items.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Commerce.Marketing.OrderFormPriceMatrix
member.summary: Container for all prices that can be associated with the line items in the referenced order form.

remarks.para: Since there might be multiple promotions modifying the same line item, you may have an intermediate state where you have different prices for a subset of the line item quantity.

Use case: You have a line item in your cart with a quantity of three. First a promotion is applied that gives 10% discount to one of those items. After that there is a buy 3 get the cheapest for free promotion applied. Since one of the items in the line item has a reduced price, the correct item that is for free should be that, and the savings should be the price after the first 10% reduction. That case is what this matrix handles. Without it, the 10% reduction would have been spread out on all the items in the line item, making the saving from the second promotion incorrect.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Commerce.Marketing.PromotionEngineSettings.ReevaluatePromotions
member.summary: Get or sets if the PromotionEngine should re-evaluate the promotions already applied to the IOrderGroup. Default is false.
member.remarks: If set to true the PromotionEngine will create a list of promotions based on the collections of the order group's order forms and then try to apply those promotions only. All found promotions that can be loaded (i.e. have not been deleted) will be evaluated even if they are currently inactive. Running the promotion engine with this flag set to true will not increase the redemption count for the promotions.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Commerce.Marketing.PromotionProcessorBase`1.GetPromotionItems(`0)
member.summary: Gets information about the settings for a specific instance of a promotion type. Used when displaying promotion information to a site visitor/shopper.

remarks.para: This method is intended to be used on a site to display information about a promotion to a visitor/shopper.

It is never used during the evaluation of the promotion, it only exists to provide information about the settings for this instance of a promotion type. So a use case for this could be that you have a "Buy 3 get the cheapest for one for free" promotion. And you want to display information to the visitor/shopper that "If you buy three items from the category cooking books, you will get the cheapest one for free".
This method should not be called explicitly from the site code, but will be called from the IPromotionEngine extension method GetPromotionItemsForCampaign.

member.param: The promotion data to get items for.
member.returns: The promotion condition and reward items.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Commerce.Marketing.PromotionProcessorBase`1.Evaluate(`0,EPiServer.Commerce.Marketing.PromotionProcessorContext)
member.summary: Evaluates a promotion against an order form. Implementations should use context.OrderForm for evaluations.
member.param: The context for the promotion processor evaluation.
member.returns: A telling whether the promotion was fulfilled, which items the promotion was applied to and to which amount.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Commerce.Marketing.PromotionProcessorBase`1.CanBeFulfilled(`0,EPiServer.Commerce.Marketing.PromotionProcessorContext)
member.summary: Verify that the current promotion can potentially be fulfilled
member.remarks: This method is intended to be a very quick pre-check to avoid doing more expensive operations. Used to verify basic things, for example a Buy-3-pay-for-2 promotion needs at least three items in the cart. If we have less than three we can skip further processing.
member.param: The context for the promotion processor evaluation.
member.returns: true if the current promotion can potentially be fulfilled; otherwise, false.
